reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005
reviews.text: stayed at nh calderon end of august 2005 for 2 nights after cruise. Booked online with alpha rooms who had cheapest rate - £112per night including breakfast. First impressions were good, check in quick and polite staff, we were given room on 2nd floor after previously requesting a room on upper floor, room was dark- tired and not over clean. When asked to be moved to a better room we were told that we had a very cheap rate and that they had nothing else available. On further investigation we realised that the hotel was under some refurbishment as the top half of the building was out of use, except for the rooftop swimming pool. Hotel is in a good position for shops and sightseeing etc and when rooms are refurbished it will be worthy of 4 stars - to sum up - breakfast buffet was very good and roof top pool also good but needs more sunbeds and chairs as i counted only 8 sunbeds which were all taken when we used the pool - did not think we got value for what we paid considering the vast amount of hotel deals in barcelona. Give it a miss until all work is complete -- trip advisor user - brighton sussex uk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NH Calderon is one of my favourite hotels in BCN for its excellent location (you can't get more central than this), comfortable rooms + the spacious rooftop pool and sun deck. The hotel lobby is slightly dark and has a bit old-fashioned, pompous feel with all the green marble and everything, but the rooms are very modern instead.
reviews.title: Brilliant location and great rooftop pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked our room on one day notice and were accomodated to one of the smaller rooms that have only a small window. Nevertheless, there was just the space needed for our luggage and I didn't mind so much about the relative dimness of the room either. Our bathroom had a walk-in shower instead of a bathtub, which was great, and was perfectly clean. Our bed was also incredibly comfortable and overall I found the room very cozy. The rooftop pool is fantastic and offers a great view over the neighbouring buildings. I can certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly if you manage to get a nice offer for the room, the hotel is quite pricey after all.
reviews.title: Excellent Deal, Room and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I first stayed at the NH Calderón 9 years ago for business and have since returned four times for leisure. The location is superb: away from the main drag but only a few hundred yards from the Plaça Catalunya (point to get off/on the Aerobus) so most tourist attractions (Barri Gotic/Ramblas/Gaudi houses) are within easy walking distance. More importantly the best tapas restaurant in town (Ciudad Condal) or possibly of the country even is just a few steps away on the other corner of the block. Needless to say we have never tried the hotel's restaurant (Ciudad Condal is excellent for breakfasts too! And for lunch, and for dinner, and for in between snackies,...).
reviews.title: The best hotel for a visit to Barcelona (returning guest)

reviews.text: The swimming pool on top of the building, although small, is a very welcome point of rest after strolling through the city on a warm day and has a superb view of the city. They could do with more sunbeds though, there never seems to be enough. There used to be a small indoor swimming pool as well on the ground floor but unfortunately it's no longer in use.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel with beautiful views of the city and mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms (both standard and superior) are fabulous: very clean and modern. The room has a flat screen tv with several foreign channels (German, French, BBC) in addition to the standard Spanish channels. The bathroom is well appointed and clean. It used to be stocked with plenty of toiletries including razor and comb. For some reason this has been stopped and so we had to go out and buy a comb and razor during our last stay... The minibar is expensive (but not outrageously), the safety box is free.

Don't be put off by the security men in the lobby either: they are very much on the ball and actually make you feel safe.

reviews.text: Cannot say enough about this hotel. I was concerned when I booked it that it was cheaper than other 4 star hotels in the area, but on arriving we were so surprised. Location is superb, right in the middle of things yet quiet. Rooms are huge and very modern. No noise from busy Barcelona streets. Lovely rooftop pool and terrace which we didn't use ( it was February!), but was a lovely escape from the city. Would highly recommend this hotel.
